subtasks: Identify the appropriate time for pruning
Gather necessary tools (pruners, big lopper, Swedish saw)
Identify branches to remove for opening the canopy
Remove tall, unnecessary branches
Remove branches causing potential rubbing
Reduce disease potential by increasing airflow
Make clean cuts on branch collars
Thin out branches for better circulation

Avoid cutting more than 25% of branches in one year MAINTASK: Training a tree for lateral branches SUBTASK: Promote lateral branches instead of upward-growing ones SUBTASK: Maintain annual pruning to control tree growth and health
** Identify the appropriate time for pruning (late March/early spring)
** Gather necessary tools (pruners, lopper, Swedish saw)
** Identify branches to remove for opening the canopy (tall branches, those growing into the center)
** Remove branches causing rubbing or potential disease spread
** Thinning branches to improve air circulation
** Make clean cuts on branch collars
** Avoid excessive pruning (no more than 25% of branches per year)

tasks.task: Training a tree for lateral branches**
subtasks: ** Promote lateral branch growth
** Maintain annual pruning to control tree shape and health
** Determine the right time to prune (late March/early spring before growth begins).
** Collect the necessary tools (pruners, lopper, Swedish saw) for effective cutting.
** Remove large, unnecessary branches to open up the canopy and improve sunlight penetration.
** Eliminate branches that grow into the center of the tree, preventing rubbing and potential disease spread.
** Thin out branches strategically to enhance airflow and reduce disease risk.
** Make clean, precise cuts at the branch collars to facilitate healing.
** Avoid removing more than 25% of the branches in a single year to prevent stressing the tree.

tasks.task: Training a tree to grow lateral branches**
subtasks: ** Encourage the tree to produce branches growing outward rather than upward.
** Regularly prune the tree annually to maintain desired shape and structure, promoting lateral growth.
